evaluation.Q1: Does the chart effectively compare the average N, P, K nutrient values across different crops?

feedback.improvement: The use of three separate bar charts for N, P, and K values allows for easy comparison across crops
Consider aligning the crop labels vertically for better readability

evaluation.Q2: Are the bars representing rice visually distinct from other crops?

feedback.improvement: The blue color used for rice bars makes them stand out from other crops

evaluation.Q3: Does the chart include clear text annotations for rice and wheat, displaying their average N, P, K values?

feedback.improvement: Include text annotations for wheat, displaying its average N, P, K values
Make the rice annotations more visible by adjusting their position or adding a background

evaluation.Q4: Is the vertical bar chart layout appropriate for comparing nutrient values across crops?

feedback.improvement: The vertical bar chart layout is suitable for comparing nutrient values
Consider reducing the number of crops shown to improve readability

evaluation.Q5: Are the crop types clearly labeled on the X-axis?

feedback.improvement: Rotate the X-axis labels for better readability
Increase font size of X-axis labels

evaluation.Q6: Does the Y-axis clearly indicate the unit of measurement for N, P, K values?

feedback.improvement: Include units of measurement on the Y-axis labels

evaluation.Q7: Is there a clear and concise title that accurately describes the data being presented?

feedback.improvement: Add an overall title that describes the comparison of N, P, K values across crops

evaluation.Q8: Can viewers easily identify patterns or trends in nutrient requirements across different crops?

feedback.improvement: The side-by-side comparison of N, P, K values allows for easy identification of patterns
Consider sorting crops by a specific nutrient value to highlight trends

evaluation.Q9: Is the color scheme used in the chart visually appealing and distinguishable between different crops?

feedback.improvement: Use a more diverse color palette to distinguish between crops more effectively
Keep the distinct blue color for rice

evaluation.Q10: Are all text elements (labels, annotations, titles) legible and appropriately sized?

feedback.improvement: Increase font size for all text elements
Improve contrast between text and background for better legibility

evaluation.Q11: Does the chart avoid unnecessary decorative elements that might distract from the data?

feedback.improvement: The chart focuses on presenting data without unnecessary decorations

evaluation.Q12: Is the complexity and detail level of the chart suitable for agricultural researchers, farmers, or agronomists?

feedback.improvement: The level of detail is appropriate for the target audience
Consider adding a brief explanation of N, P, K significance for less experienced viewers

evaluation.Q13: Does the chart emphasize rice and wheat data as specified in the instructions?

feedback.improvement: Highlight wheat data similarly to rice for emphasis
Include text annotations for wheat as specified in the instructions

evaluation.Q14: Are the annotations for rice and wheat placed in a way that doesn't obstruct other important data points?

feedback.improvement: The current placement of rice annotations doesn't obstruct other data points
Include annotations for wheat, ensuring they don't obstruct other data

evaluation.Q15: Does the overall design of the chart contribute to a professional and polished appearance?

feedback.improvement: Improve overall layout and spacing for a more polished look
Use a consistent color scheme across all three charts
Include a border around each chart for a more finished appearance
